intro: Dolichocarpa spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed dolichocarpa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display. The plant's botanical features make it a notable species in horticultural collections.
